intro: Dicraeia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant is a succulent, with fleshy, often hairy stems and leaves that are usually opposite. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in xeriscaped gardens.
